NuGet.0002.description:
NuGet package upgrade is recommended for selected target framework.

Standard .NET packages are recommended to have versions matching version of .NET that project targets.

Some other packages also are known to work better for selected target frameworks.
NuGet.0002.label: NuGet package upgrade is recommended

NuGet.0003.description:
NuGet package functionality is included with framework reference.

Package needs to be removed.
NuGet.0003.label: NuGet package functionality is included with framework reference

NuGet.0001.description:
NuGet package is incompatible with selected target framework.

Package needs to be upgraded to a version supporting selected project target framework. If there no new package versions supporting new target framework, different package needs to be used and all code needs to be upgraded to new API.
NuGet.0001.label: NuGet package is incompatible

NuGet.0004.description:
NuGet package contains security vulnerabilities.

Package needs to be upgraded to a newer version that addresses known security vulnerabilities.
NuGet.0004.label: NuGet package contains security vulnerability

NuGet.0005.description:
NuGet package is deprecated.

Go to its documentation and if there is a guidance for replacement of functionality provided by this package.
NuGet.0005.label: NuGet package is deprecated

Project.0001.description: Project file needs to be converted to SDK-style. Modern .NET framework projects require a change in the project file format and use SDK corresponding to project flavor and functionality.
Project.0001.label: Project file needs to be converted to SDK-style

links.title: Overview of porting from .NET Framework to .NET

Project.0002.description:
Project's target framework(s) needs to be changed to the new target framework that you selected for this upgrade.

During upgrade target framework will be adjusted to corresponding platform when applicable. In some cases project would result in multiple target frameworks after the upgrade if it was using features that now have their own platforms in modern .NET frameworks (windows, iOS, Android etc).
Project.0002.label: Project's target framework(s) needs to be changed

links.title: Overview of porting from .NET Framework to .NET

Feature.0001.description: System.Web.Optimization bundling and minification is not supported in .NET Core and should be replaced with actual html tags pointing to content files.
Feature.0001.label: System.Web.Optimization bundling and minification is not supported in .NET Core and should be replaced with actual html tags pointing to content files

Feature.1000.description: Convert application initialization code from Global.asax.cs to .NET Core and clean up Global.asax.cs.
Feature.1000.label: Convert application initialization code from Global.asax.cs to .NET Core and clean up Global.asax.cs

Feature.0003.description: GlobalFilterCollection is not supported in .NET Core and needs to be converted to the corresponding middleware registrations on the application object.
Feature.0003.label: GlobalFilterCollection is not supported in .NET Core and needs to be converted to the corresponding middleware registrations on the application object

Feature.0002.description: Routes registration via RouteCollection is not supported in .NET Core and needs to be converted to the route mappings on the application object.
Feature.0002.label: Routes registration via RouteCollection is not supported in .NET Core and needs to be converted to the route mappings on the application object

Api.0002.description: API is source incompatible for selected .NET version: requires code changes to compile successfully when targeting a new version, such as removing obsolete APIs or changing method signatures.
Api.0002.label: Source incompatible for selected .NET version

Api.0001.description: API is binary incompatible for selected .NET version: affects existing binaries, often requiring recompilation, because the API has changed in a way that prevents older binaries from loading or executing.
Api.0001.label: Binary incompatible for selected .NET version

LegacyConfiguration.description: Legacy XML-based configuration system (app.config/web.config) that has been replaced by a more flexible configuration model in .NET Core. The old system was rigid and XML-based. Migrate to Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration with JSON/environment variables; use System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager NuGet package as interim bridge if needed.
LegacyConfiguration.label: Legacy Configuration System

SystemWeb.description: Legacy ASP.NET Framework APIs for web applications (System.Web.*) that don't exist in ASP.NET Core due to architectural differences. ASP.NET Core represents a complete redesign of the web framework. Migrate to ASP.NET Core equivalents or consider System.Web.Adapters package for compatibility.
SystemWeb.label: ASP.NET Framework (System.Web)

links.title: Migrate from ASP.NET to ASP.NET Core
